about_the_game:
"…Nahida…"

"I finally… see you again…"


This game is a fan-made visual novel based on the popular game Genshin Impact, using its world-building and character settings.

  • Original script and case design, featuring captivating reasoning and suspenseful storylines

  • 7 to 8 hours of immersive gameplay

  • A tribute to the classic "Ace Attorney" courtroom mechanics, where evidence and questioning peel back the layers of a mysterious case

  • Custom character art and variations, with nearly 30 story CGs

  • Full voice acting for all characters and main storylines

  • Unlockable side-game "Turtle Soup" mini-games as the main story progresses

After the Traveler, Nahida, and their companions resolved the crisis in Sumeru City, Nahida remained dedicated to the nation's governance, and under her leadership, Sumeru improved with each passing day.

However, a new crisis has arisen. Frequent tremors signal an unprecedented disaster that threatens to engulf all of Teyvat. Nahida suspects that the Irminsul is once again plagued by illness.

In a moment of helplessness, a strange sensation leads her to a mysterious room…

One day, you and Paimon receive an invitation from Nahida for a vacation. Along with Alhaitham and Dehya, you touch a peculiar canister of knowledge and find yourselves transported to Sumeru's past, as stored within the canister.

But during the Sabzeruz Festival, strange events begin to unfold. Odd dreams, bizarre murders, familiar yet foreign faces, and a nation without its god… "Is this… really Sumeru?"

Explore this unknown world, uncover the truth behind the murder and the frequent tremors; and perhaps, meet her once again…

Finally, save the world, and unravel the secrets of the Irminsul and all of Teyvat.

short_description: Return to the past in Sumeru with Nahida. Witness the true Sabzeruz Festival, solve an "impossible crime" in a locked chamber, and face tremors heralding the world's end. In a Sumeru without its "god," can you uncover the truth, unveil Teyvat's ultimate secrets, and... reunite with "her" once more?
